result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon Ivan Sanchez

defendant.name: Sanchez, Marlon Ivan
defendant.address: N3619 Ogema Prentice Rd, Prentice, WI 54556

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): G.J.H     DOB: 10/14/1953

**No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

1:02 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Marlon Sanchez appeared via video from the Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz in person for The State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's next court date is 11/08/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives Defendant a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested by the State.
